TEI.2.document_title: James Gallagher and Sons to Moses Austin, 07-16-1806

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 110

div1.p: We have been waiting with patience for the amount of your debt due to James Gallagher (decd) which you promis'd to pay at Orleans or forward a draft on Philaa as you mention'd in your letter of the 26th of October 1805. The business with us is this that there is to be a settlement of the Estate of James Gallagher (decd) to take place in next month so that if the account is not paid by that time we must resort to means which would be very disagreeable to your Humble Servants
for the Eexecutors of the Estate of James Gallagher
N B On the other side is your account current
To the Estate or James Gallagher Dr
" By Or P. W. Gallandets note__________________ £39.10-0
